summary: The Poarch Band of Creek Indians Parity Act aims to reaffirm the applicability of the Indian Reorganization Act to the Poarch Band of Creek Indians. It clarifies that the tribe is under federal jurisdiction as of June 18, 1934, for the purposes of the Act. Additionally, the bill reaffirms all lands taken into trust by the United States for the benefit of the Poarch Band of Creek Indians before the enactment of the Act, ratifying and confirming the Secretary of the Interior's actions in taking those lands into trust.
